website_summaries.verdict: These 2 air horns churn out a loud warning with the deep sound you expect from a truck horn.
pros: Get noticed with long, dual horn trumpets
cons: Requires an air compressor or onboard air system up to 150 psi
No hoses or other accessories included

customer_reviews.title: Loud Ambulance, British Pipe Thread/Metric
customer_reviews.text: Kleinn horns are louder than others, hinse replacing the cheap triple set up on my truck. When towing its great to be heard. This two tone horn is as loud if not louder than the ambulace it mimics. The last star is left off due to Cheap chrome Solenoid with British Pipe thread. Yes it will reverse thread but before you jam a npt into it, tap with 1/8" fine thread so you dont have to do 3 adapters to get to push in style. I have a Viar 2 gal combo at 150psi with push in connectors, 1/4" dot line. Video outside gopro underpass
customer_reviews.author: C. K.

customer_reviews.title: Intimidator!
customer_reviews.text: Installed them behind the center of the front bumper angled sideways and slightly down. Since they are on a 4wd truck which hammers across gravel roads, I added a strap to support the front end of the horn. They are powered with a 120psi onboard compressor with 3 gallon tank used for air bags. I left the OEM horns in place and connected since that are inside the front passenger fender and they sound together. Sounds great! The first 'victim' was a compact car who thought he would squeeze from the right lane, in front of me on a merge. NOT! He got a nasty surprise.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Hericks

customer_reviews.title: Sound good and LOUD!!!
customer_reviews.text: These horns make alot of noise considering their size! Work great on my 2000 F350. I already had a Viair on-board air system, so I just plumbed these horns into my existing air lines. The solenoid is super easy to wire once you realize that it doesn't matter which wire you use for ground. The other wire just run to a momentary push-button switch, then to 12v source and you're in business! Lots of people mention having issues finding a mounting location. I have a lifted crew cab long bed F350 so no issues finding a mounting location.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Solid built and great sounding.
customer_reviews.text: These are very well made and big. They deliver loud, low tones as long as you have something that will push a lot of air. I would recommend something that is at least 100psi and a minimum of a 1 gallon air tank. If you as going to blow the horns longer than a second or two, definitely get a bigger tank. I have these mounted in the bumper of my Jeep Wrangler and will definitely get someone's attention.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Trumpets are strong, solenoid valve is weak.
customer_reviews.text: The trumpets are excellent, the solenoid valve is anemic. I bought it and it was weak. I read the reviews about the deffective valve. I had to replace it for a 3/8 solenoid valve and a 3/8 female to 1/4 male fitting adapter, this actually transformed the air horns into beasts. Big punch of a screaming oir horn power just by touching the steering wheel cover. Make sure you remove the trumpets (yes they are rrmovanle and they unscrew and could also be interchanged right or left) to be able to fit the solenoid valve.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco Campos

customer_reviews.title: Loud and Easy Install
customer_reviews.text: I installed this horn on my 2015 Ram and they work great. It was easy install since I already had an on-board compressor and tank. I ran the wiring to an ignition powered circuit to not drain the battery. I installed a flush mount switch under the dash. It is extremely loud and really gets peoples attention.
customer_reviews.author: rsoots

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound
customer_reviews.text: Husband is like a kid in candy shop now when we tow the boat or 5th Wheel. He almost loves when people pull out in front of him now that he can blast this horn at them. Nice deep sound, and works with the door locks, so now when using your fob to lock/unlock car, you have a deep grunt instead of a beep. We both like it.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Brace

customer_reviews.title: DAMN! These things are LOUD!!
customer_reviews.text: I installed these along with the Wolo (800) Tiger Air Tank and Compressor. Wow They are loud. it made me jump even though I thought I was ready for it. These will definitely get someones attention. I think I will be using my horn a lot more from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Ken

customer_reviews.title: Good horns, junk air valve
customer_reviews.text: The horn itself sounds great but the air valve is junk. It will not tolerate pressures over 60 psi. The threads are not pipe thread or metric, I haven't a clue what system they used when they threaded the fittings. I will keep the horns but plan on buying a better valve
customer_reviews.author: Aaron B.

customer_reviews.title: Horn is great! Solenoid not so much.
customer_reviews.text: When I first installed horn I was super happy with the results. Then the next day it didn’t work. The solenoid was overheated and crumbled. Might have been my fault for listening to the comments section for fuse and wire size. So I messaged the seller to figure out the right size fuse (5 amp) and I bought another solenoid. After installing, it still started to overheat and crumble. So I ended up wiring it to a switch that I must flip before pulling the horn chain. An extra step but it keeps it from overheating so it works.
customer_reviews.author: Jeramiah Sayre

customer_reviews.title: Garbage solenoid!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Used the horn 2 times and now the solenoid has failed. 2 times....are you serious! Now I have to find a better one. This frustrates the hell outta me. The time I spent installing this is a complete waste.
customer_reviews.author: D. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Loud horn !!
customer_reviews.text: Really loud , low air consumption I’m very happy 😃 . I used my work compressor with quick connects to provide the air . Connects to old horn electrical wiring . Hardest part was running the air lines back to the compressor it took one hour
customer_reviews.author: mike2366  Installer

customer_reviews.title: the threads are crap! I had to run a tap threw them ...
customer_reviews.text: Horn is LOUD!!! my gripe is with the solenoid, the threads are crap! I had to run a tap threw them and still had a very hard time getting a fitting to thread in correct.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great horn, but it’s hungry!
customer_reviews.text: The horn is great, I love the tone, but it needs more air than the direct drive is giving it to really power these to their full potential. I’ll be upgrading from the direct drive to a compressor and tank before long.
customer_reviews.author: S. Sheard

customer_reviews.title: See video for sound.  Excellent Tone.
customer_reviews.text: How did I go all this time with out one. Nice tone. Drowned out the stock electric horns
customer_reviews.author: Crazy Marty

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Loud
customer_reviews.text: Impressive with the solid and loud sound base on the price. I got it to replace my old set and can’t be more satisfied with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Julio C. Vega

customer_reviews.title: Loud
customer_reviews.text: We are accustomed to air horns, lots of trucks around, and these air horns will not disappoint
customer_reviews.author: Brian Dunning

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: great looking, but did not fit my car, it's too big to fit FJ cruiser !!
customer_reviews.author: Artistic S

customer_reviews.title: Trumpets and loud and sound great. Horns have a little flex in them
customer_reviews.text: Trumpets and loud and sound great. Horns have a little flex in them. I wish the two horn could be clamped together towards the end of the trumpet to provide more stability.
customer_reviews.author: SemiPro

customer_reviews.title: Replace 1/8 air fitting with 1/4” for best performance.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Solid construction, super loud. Cons: the fitting on the solenoid is for 1/8” hose. Replaced with 1/4” fitting to provide better air flow. Replaced a 4 trumpet horn with these. Much better sound.
customer_reviews.author: Guy M

customer_reviews.title: JUNK BROKE AND USED
customer_reviews.text: These were used horns broken fittings unable to install JUNK!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: artschuerg

customer_reviews.title: Loud deep train sound
customer_reviews.text: Great deep train sound. Not tingy like the other brands
customer_reviews.author: Frank Baker

customer_reviews.title: CSX would use this!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Tough. 18 wheeler in your way....none issue. Simply keep a sir tank on your ride or compressor. Your set.
customer_reviews.author: sRose

customer_reviews.title: Beastly Air Horn🔊🔊🔊
customer_reviews.text: It became a beast of an air horn after I piped in 1/2 inch air supply line at 150 PSI from a 3 gallon air tank into a heavy duty solenoid with an over sized orifice. Sounds louder than Emergency vehicle air horns.
customer_reviews.author: Technically Inclined

customer_reviews.title: These things are loud!
customer_reviews.text: These beasts are loud. Have them mounted behind license plate of 2013 F-250 and now I get the attention of bad drivers! Matched them up with a VIAIR 20007 air compressor kit.
customer_reviews.author: Sideline24

customer_reviews.title: Ditch the solenoid
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Do yourself a favor and upgrade the junky solenoid and buy one of these instead. Vixen Air VXF2038 3/8 NPT Solenoid 210 PSI
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Blake

customer_reviews.title: Very loud.
customer_reviews.text: When other reviewers say these are loud, they are not kidding. Tested it in the garage and it practically shook the house.
customer_reviews.author: L. South

customer_reviews.title: Low tone and loud
customer_reviews.text: Piped the horns into my onboard air system on my Jeep. I run a max air pressure of 120 PSI. Even with that air pressure these are loud and have a nice low tone to them.
customer_reviews.author: kevin warner

customer_reviews.title: Deep base sound
customer_reviews.text: Love this horn. I had a quad horn and it was high pitched. I was looking for that deep base horn and got it with this horn. I ordered a 2nd horn. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: eric medina

customer_reviews.title: Holy LOUD!!!
customer_reviews.text: works with my Viar kit. super easy installation and OMG LOUD!!
customer_reviews.author: Blkhk1up

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: My grandson like it very much for his truck. FYI you also need a compressor to make this work
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: They look great and sound even better
customer_reviews.text: These horns were a replacement for my old horns. They look great and sound even better. I will definitely buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Bombero37A

customer_reviews.title: Loud honker
customer_reviews.text: I've had these horns for over a year now and they still work great!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Lab

customer_reviews.title: Super loud. Hard to verify but thought the tone ...
customer_reviews.text: Super loud. Hard to verify but thought the tone of my klienn 102 in chrome had a better tone.
customer_reviews.author: RichKP

customer_reviews.title: Super loud!
customer_reviews.text: I installed this horn on my 18 wheeler. It was super easy to put on and is twice as loud as the horn that came with the truck! An absolute must have!
customer_reviews.author: S. E. Davis

customer_reviews.title: That they do not come with anything but mounting hardware.. no hoses or anything else
customer_reviews.text: They are of good metal construction and good black coating. The bad: I expected them to have a deeper tone for the length..like a real truck..sounds more like a train horn
customer_reviews.author: Greg LeBlond

customer_reviews.title: Kleinn horns black
customer_reviews.text: Very nice horns. I like the dark paint and hope it will keep it from corroding. Loud horns that will get peoples attention better than the stock horn.
customer_reviews.author: scott simmons

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small volume tanks
customer_reviews.text: I've installed and tried many different horns for a smaller tank this is an excellent sound and tone would definitely buy it again
customer_reviews.author: James Bushong

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: Got it hooked up and works as expected. I'll be installing the same unit in a buddy's truck soon.
customer_reviews.author: Carl F

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the RV - grumbly tone, not super high pitched.
customer_reviews.author: D3thM3tal

customer_reviews.title: Remember it's a truck horn not a train  horn!
customer_reviews.text: Great price for this truck horn, very load. I'm pushing 145 psi and it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Martin K.

customer_reviews.title: Too Loud - Too Bad
customer_reviews.text: On the outside of the box it says "Too Loud - Too Bad". And, it meets that criteria. Excellent quality and easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: Kick A$$ horns. I know train "horn loud"and "wannaB ...
customer_reviews.text: Kick A$$ horns. I know train "horn loud"and "wannaB loud"... I put these with another 3 horn set from Klein and honestly the two combined... WOW!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too Loud! Too Bad!  Love It!
customer_reviews.text: Totally what I expected! Love the fact that you can hear samples of what the horns sound like!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Came broken
customer_reviews.text: Came broken and didn’t find out until the install and too late to return.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: awesome opossum!
customer_reviews.text: they say on the box that is really loud they meant its REALLY! LOUD!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: tod

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: horn kit appeared to be very good quality and they are very loud
customer_reviews.author: dkHodaka

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product, they're nice and loud and they really ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product, they're nice and loud and they really get people's attention. The sound bite on the manufacturers web site does not do them justice, let's just say I was pleasantly surprised.
customer_reviews.author: Gavin Gee

customer_reviews.title: Too loud?  Too bad !
customer_reviews.text: That's the company's slogan, and appropriate. These horns are Very loud, a quality product !
customer_reviews.author: Bibliophile

customer_reviews.title: Great deep horns, quality construction.
customer_reviews.text: These horns are fantastic, much deeper sound compared to the triple train horns that I had on there previously. I am running about 160 PSI to them and they are loud and sound like a semi!
customer_reviews.author: S. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Too Loud ? - Nope - Just right in the interstate !
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely a great air horn. Fits right behind the license plate bracket on Ford SuperDuty PU's. Connected to a Wolo compressor. Great replacement for the factory beep beep 'horn'
customer_reviews.author: PDGx

customer_reviews.title: The horns came very quickly and look great. We still have not installed them so choose ...
customer_reviews.text: The horns came very quickly and look great. We still have not installed them so choose 4 stars, because I am not sure of the sound yet. I am sure they will be great. *EDIT* We installed the horns, and they work great. Very loud, which was the point.
customer_reviews.author: karamy

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great. One horn went out within the first week
customer_reviews.text: Very loud. Sounds great. One horn went out within the first week. I'll be calling looking for a refund or exchange.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: no compessor
customer_reviews.text: No where does is say you need an air compressor on the description. Some models on here say they have them built in. So now I need to order another part and wait for a week or two when the description could of avoided this
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Callarik

customer_reviews.title: Perfect 18-wheeler sound.
customer_reviews.text: These were easy to install. I already had an air suspension system with an air tank. Most air horns are either just "loud car" or sound like a locomotive. These split the difference with an 18-wheeler type of sound. I disconnected the factory horns and spliced in the solenoid for the air horns, ran an air line and was done. Installation took way less than an hour. The horns are long, so the hardest part was just deciding where to mount them. I have mine behind the lower grill on an aftermarket "RanchHand" bumper/grille guard.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Arno

customer_reviews.title: Plenty loud
customer_reviews.text: Heavy metal means great sound. Like a pipe organ. I didn't like the 1/4" compression nipple so I replaced with 3/8" push to connect using Nylon air tube from my compressor tank. I have a 5 gallon tank, filled from an onboard service compressor which is powered by a PTO driven generator so I cannot refill the tank on the fly. Truck has to be stopped to use the generator. I figure I have 30+ seconds of loud horn. I have backup electrical horns which switch on when the tank runs below 60 PSI.
customer_reviews.author: Keith J.

product_meta.title: Kleinn Air Horns 102-1 Dual Air Horn - Black
feature_bullets: Long Trumpets For Deeper Truck Horn Sound
All Metal Body And Trumpets With Black XCR2.0 Corrosion Resistant Coating
Vortex 4 – 12-Volt Electronic Air Horn Solenoid Included
